column4: can someone help? upgraded to dapper, everything works fine but i'm having trouble with the gnome panel. when i enter gnome, the top panel is frozen, doesn't respond to mouse clicks, and has no applets running on it etc (just has menus). if i kill/restart it, same thing
i think it's a session problem, or a problem with one of the panel applets
try a making a new user and see if it happens there
can i msg them to you? they're only 2 lines
the first one is hostname I assume?
change hostname to 'richcorp' all by itself and /etc/hosts to '/home/jasonr/docs/school/cse398/hw2.pdf
i'm worried i might have mangled some file iceauth or dcop uses, there was a bad reset and then this trouble started
one sec, that was a typo :)
change hostname to 'richcorp' all by itself and /etc/hosts to '127.0.0.1 localhost.localdomain localhost richcorp'.  That's what mine look like.  That should let you use sudo at least
sure that will work too I suppose
LinuxJones oh my *god* found problem - in my /etc/hostname i have richcorp<new line>localhost
LinuxJones thanks for your help, rebooting and fixing it now =P
